body:
I am sorry but your code does not compile cleanly

```
lucky(~/src/github.com/juju/juju) % go get github.com/sagar8192/Flash



# github.com/sagar8192/Flash
../../sagar8192/Flash/dispatcher.go:50: undefined: m
../../sagar8192/Flash/dispatcher.go:56: undefined: m
../../sagar8192/Flash/kafka_client.go:14: CheckError redeclared in this
block
        previous declaration at ../../sagar8192/Flash/collector.go:12
../../sagar8192/Flash/kafka_worker.go:39: undefined: check
../../sagar8192/Flash/kafka_worker.go:55: undefined: check
../../sagar8192/Flash/main.go:31: main redeclared in this block
        previous declaration at ../../sagar8192/Flash/kafka_client.go:20
```

Please restructure your code into two packages, a client binary and a
server binary (go run is not suitable for writing anything by non trivial
programs).


On Mon, Mar 7, 2016 at 12:51 PM, uaintnothug <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> In order to reproduce exclude kafka_client.go from the build. After
> creating the executable. Just run the executable and then run following:
>
> watch -n 0.1 go run kafka_client.go
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/14673#issuecomment-193043128>.
>
